Mae Hia,  Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai

rmk:
This is breeding song of the male Red Avadavat. In the Monsoon or favourable climatic conditions male select bush top or reed top to deliver this call. Male use to give call with intervals from same perch.

This is very beautiful but common bird around wet land and reed beds.
This is the communication call of female.
Natural vocalizations from a flock of birds (all appeared to be in female plumage) in a gully with introduced fountain grass and some shrubs in other fairly open, arid habitat.

Courela do Sorraia, Couço, Coruche, Santarém

rmk: This recording was not modified. The sound was apparently coming from the canopy of a mixed woodland open-forest with some cork-oak and pine trees, although the reeds are just adjacent to those woods. The bird was not seen. Weather was fine with just a few clouds, around 20ºC, and wing-gusts < 20Km/h.
